definition: to visit places famous for their scenery

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: Suddenly, I want to ascend Mt. Taishan with you, hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，好想和你牵手，登临泰山。

sentences.english: It also signals a peak in the world hybrid rice arena, as the technology was developed by Chinese scientist Yuan Longping, crowned as the "father of the super hybrid rice."
sentences.chinese: 这也是世界杂交水稻史上迄今尚无人登临的一个高峰。

sentences.english: When we climbed to the peak of mountain.
sentences.chinese: 当我们最终登临峨眉山顶。

sentences.english: Board on it, only see the vast sea, sky color.
sentences.chinese: 登临其上，唯见大海浩瀚，水天一色。

sentences.english: On whose last steps I climb.
sentences.chinese: 我正登临你最后的梯阶。

sentences.english: Flowers, as high as my window, hurt the heart of a wanderer.
sentences.chinese: 花近高楼伤客心，万方多难此登临。

sentences.english: According to historical records, prior to the western zhou Dynasty, 72 monarchs climbed Mount Tai to perform sacrifices.
sentences.chinese: 据历史记载，西周前已有72位君王登临泰山祭祀。

definition: to lean on sth and gaze into the distance
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
as far as the eye can see
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
to view/to look at/to look sth over

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
to go up or down stairs step by step
to observe from afar/to look into the distance from a high place
